intro: Erigeron dicladus, commonly known as the two-leaved fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky soils. It has slender, branching stems and hairy leaves that are usually less than 2 inches long. Erigeron dicladus produces small white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months.
